author: Lily Zhou
description: The police didn't release the number of victims or confirm whether there were fatalities. A witness said at least six children were killed.
title: Several Children Killed as Car Hits Crowd Near School in Beijing, Witnesses Say

author: Ryan Morgan
description: Fifteen years ago, military planners tasked two employees to find a way to destroy the Iranian underground nuclear facility.
title: How the Pentagon Made a Bunker Buster Specifically for Fordow

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Military Exercise in France, Navy Induction Day, and Saint Bernard Museum

author: Jack Phillips
description: 'Would take too long, too dangerous, and very heavy and hard to move,' the U.S. president says.
title: Trump Says Iran Didn’t Take Anything Out of Facility Ahead of Strike

author: Carolina Avendano
description: The Canada Infrastructure Bank is providing a $1 billion loan to BC Ferries to purchase four new vessels from a Chinese state-owned shipyard, a move that has sparked concern among federal and provincial politicians alike. The Canada Infrastructure Bank (CIB), a federal Crown corporation, made the announcement on June 26, saying the below-market-rate financing provided […]
title: Federal Infrastructure Bank Providing $1B Loan to BC Ferries to Buy Vessels From Chinese Shipyard

author: Chandra Philip
description: A community in Eastern Ontario is mourning after a 9-year-old boy died after he was hit by a school bus while riding his bike.  The boy has been identified on social media as Archer Lowe from Almonte, Ontario.  He was hit while riding his bike near a school at around 3:40 p.m. on June 25, […]
title: Ontario Community Grieving After ‘Vibrant’ 9-Year-Old Dies Following Collision With School Bus

author: Chandra Philip
description: Ottawa has changed its requirements for post-study work permits, adding more than 100 fields of study to its list of eligible programs that students can complete before applying for work visas. Meanwhile, 178 formerly eligible fields have now been cut. The move is part of broader student visa changes first announced in November 2024. The […]
title: Ottawa Changes Rules for International Students Wanting to Stay in Canada for Work Experience

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The Western separatist movement is reaching levels of support seen during the initial surge of Quebec’s independence movement in the 1980s, says a new study from the Aristotle Foundation for Public Policy.  The report, released on June 26, noted that while support for Western separatism is still not as high as Quebec at the peak […]
title: Support for Western Separatism Nearing Levels of 1980s Quebec: New Study

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Defence Minister David McGuinty says Ottawa is considering two different partnerships with Ukraine to co-produce drones, following the lead of other European countries. McGuinty made the comments at a press conference following a two-day visit to Latvia on June 26, saying Ukraine has made “huge strides and advances in drone technologies” because of its war […]
title: Defence Minister Says Canada Considering Ukraine Partnership for Drones

author: Lee Hall
description: NTD’s Lee Hall sits down with Helena Ivanov, an associate fellow at the Henry Jackson Society, to talk about the deepening crisis of trust in nongovernmental organizations (NGOs). Ivanov says that erosion of trust threatens their ability to operate effectively and help the people they are supposed to serve. She also talks about how authoritarian […]
title: Human Rights NGOs Are Facing an Existential Crisis of Trust: Helena Ivanov

author: The Canadian Press
description: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement says that a 49-year-old Canadian has died while in its custody. A detainee death notification from the agency, commonly known as ICE, says that Johnny Noviello was pronounced dead by the Miami Fire Rescue Department at 1:36 p.m. on Monday. The agency says he was found unresponsive at a federal […]
title: A 49-Year-Old Canadian Has Died While in ICE Custody in Florida

author: Olivia Gomm
description: French sporting goods retailer Decathlon will shutter five of its stores in the Greater Toronto Area (GTA) this summer. Decathlon Canada said in a statement that its “evolving” its retail strategy in the GTA, including changing its store presence in the area. “The retail landscape is changing with consumers valuing variety across online and in-store […]
title: Decathlon Canada to Close Five Toronto-Area Stores

author: The Canadian Press
description: A Senate spokesman says Sen. Patrick Brazeau is recovering after a “dizzy spell” made him “briefly lose consciousness” Tuesday during debate in the Senate on the government’s major projects bill. The 50-year-old Independent senator rose to speak before falling sideways to the floor just after 4 p.m. yesterday. The Senate spokesman says Brazeau was taken […]
title: Brazeau Recovering After Collapsing in Senate Wednesday Due to ‘Dizzy Spell’

author: Dorothy Li
description: A town in southwestern China was hit by a flood on a scale that domestic media described as unprecedented over the past 50 years.
title: At Least 6 Dead in Southern China Floods

author: Naveen Athrappully
description: Conagra, Kraft Heinz, and Sam’s Club announced similar measures this month.
title: Nestlé to Remove Synthetic Colors From US Products

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Health Canada is warning Canadians about the risks of purchasing online drugs and health products, after an international operation targeting counterfeit medications resulted in the confiscation of more than 19,000 packages before they could enter the country. The June 25 advisory comes the same day that the International Criminal Police Organization (Interpol) announced the seizure […]
title: Health Canada Warns About Fake Online Drugs After Interpol Crackdown

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Ministers say urgent welfare reform is needed as disability benefit claims surge and costs rise.
title: Starmer Says Welfare Reform Talks Ongoing Amid Backbench Rebellion

author: Rachel Roberts
description: Mounjaro is the first weight-loss drug that family doctors can prescribe directly to patients meeting strict criteria, with demand expected to exceed supply.
title: GPs Begin Prescribing Weight Loss Jabs to Obese Patients on NHS

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The prime minister made the remarks after Health Secretary Wes Streeting said last week that there was no budget for a medically-assisted dying service.
title: Starmer ‘Confident’ on Assisted Suicide Bill Despite Streeting’s Budget Concerns

author: Alicia Márquez
description: Víctor Mosquera Marín, the lawyer for Colombian presidential candidate Miguel Uribe Turbay, filed a lawsuit on June 24 against Colombian President Gustavo Petro for alleged harassment. Petro wrote 43 posts on social media promoting “a hostile, discriminatory, and hateful environment against Miguel Uribe.” Mosquera said on June 24 at a press conference outside the Fundación […]
title: Miguel Uribe’s Lawyer Files Criminal Complaint Against Colombian President for Alleged Harassment

author: Savannah Hulsey Pointer
description: The oldest soldier on base was a 28-year-old captain.
title: How 44 US Soldiers Defended a Key Base From Iranian Missile Attack

author: Jack Phillips
description: Hegseth criticized the media for downplaying the success of U.S. strikes on Iran's nuclear program.
title: Pentagon Chief Says No Known Intelligence Shows Iran Moved Uranium

author: Jack Phillips
description: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei suggested that the United States did not destroy Iran's nuclear capabilities.
title: Iranian Leader Khamenei Issues First Public Remarks After US Airstrike

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The average asking price for rental units in Montreal increased by nearly 71 percent between 2019 and the first quarter of this year, according to Statistics Canada. The average asking rent for a two-bedroom unit in Montreal was $1,130 in 2019, which increased by 70.8 percent to $1,930 by the first quarter of 2025, according […]
title: Asking Rent Prices in Montreal Have Jumped More Than 70 Percent Since 2019: StatCan

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: There is no evidence to indicate the outcome of April’s federal election was influenced by foreign interference, disinformation, or voter intimidation, despite a marked increase in the number of complaints about the campaign, Canada’s elections commissioner says. A preliminary report from Commissioner Caroline Simard said her office received 16,115 complaints related to the spring campaign […]
title: No Indications of Foreign Influence on 2025 Federal Election, Says Commissioner

author: Jackson Richman
description: Gen. Dan Caine, after describing U.S. strikes on Iran, had a message to adversaries: U.S. intelligence members are studying targets in their countries.
title: After US Strikes on Iran, Top General Sends Message to America’s Adversaries

author: The Canadian Press
description: The federal banking regulator says the amount of money Canada’s big banks must keep on hand in case of economic shock will stay at its current level. The Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions held its domestic stability buffer at 3.5 percent. The buffer applies to Canada’s six largest, or systemically important, banks. Superintendent […]
title: OSFI Keeps Domestic Stability Buffer on Hold at 3.5 Percent

author: The Canadian Press
description: The search for three people who were unaccounted for after a medical transport helicopter crashed on Quebec’s North Shore came to an end late Wednesday night after police divers located their bodies in a lake. Montreal-area company Airmedic says Quebec’s provincial police have found the bodies of its two missing crew members, along with a […]
title: Bodies of Three People Missing After Airmedic Helicopter Crash in Quebec Recovered

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: UK children are writing less for fun than ever before, as literacy experts warn of a deepening engagement crisis.
title: Children’s Enjoyment of Writing at Historic Low: Report

author: Owen Evans
description: The European Council is also convening to hash out defence pledges and security priorities.
title: EU Leaders to Discuss Looming US Tariffs at Summit

author: Jackson Richman
description: Fordow, which is underground a mountain range, was one of the three nuclear sites bombed by the United States on June 21.
title: Pentagon Details How Bunker-Buster Bombs Hit Iran’s Fordow Nuclear Site

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Western Sydney University has received a warning after hosting an event attended by Iran's state-run TV station.
title: Australian University Warned Over Event Attended by Sanctioned Iranian State Broadcaster

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The Planning (Social Impact and Community Benefit) and Other Legislation Amendment Bill 2025 (pdf) passed the state parliament on June 26.
title: Queensland Passes Law Allowing Olympics Projects to Bypass 15 Planning Laws

author: James Xu
description: It's 'extremely important' for Japan to improve its defense capabilities in a 'severe security environment,' a Tokyo government spokesperson said.
title: Japan Tests First Surface-to-Ship Missile at Home

author: Katabella Roberts
description: José Adolfo Macías escaped from a prison in Guayaquil, Ecuador, where he was serving a 34-year sentence.
title: Ecuador Recaptures Most Wanted Gang Leader More Than 1 Year After He Escapes Prison

author: Joseph Lord
description: 'This package reflects the Trump administration's steadfast commitment to cutting wasteful federal spending antithetical to American interests,' Vought said.
title: Vought Pushes for Adoption of Budget Rescissions as Key Senators Remain Unconvinced

author: Alfred Bui
description: ABC Managing Director Hugh Marks has defended the broadcaster's handling of the lawsuit while saying it was a 'great learning exercise.'
title: ABC’s Unlawful Dismissal Case Could Cost Taxpayers $2 Million

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: A woman has been sentenced to 2 years' jail for illegally importing a massive amount of produce from Thailand, including frogs and prawns.
title: Woman Jailed for Illegally Importing 62,000 Kilograms of Black Market Produce

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Best News Entertainment runs three radio stations, a news outlet and TV stations.
title: New Zealand’s ‘Largest’ Chinese Media Firm Goes Bust, Again

author: Lily Zhou
description: They found 20 novel viruses in bat kidneys, including two novel henipaviruses that can potentially be passed on to humans.
title: Scientists Find New Bat Viruses in China, Linked to Deadly Hendra and Nipah Viruses

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Queensland is changing its rules about energy projects, with a key move to scrap net zero targets.
title: Queensland’s LNP Scraps Net Zero Targets, Imposes Stricter Rules for New Renewables Projects

author: Olivia Li
description: U.S. strikes on Iran’s nuclear sites prompt Chinese leaders to urgently revise military plans and foreign messaging.
title: Insider Reveals Beijing’s Anxiety Over Sudden Regional Shift After US Strikes on Iran

author: Alfred Bui
description: Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles said Australia was not influenced by NATO's commitment to increase defence budget to 5 percent.
title: Australia’s Defence Spending Remains Unchanged After NATO Funding Boost

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: A Wedgetail aircraft and 100 Defence Force personnel are to be sent to Ukraine.
title: Australia Sends Defence Aircraft to Ukraine, Strengthens NATO Ties

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Ley says the Coalition’s energy panel will build a long-term plan for cheaper power and lower emissions, not a one-off policy review.
title: Coalition’s Energy Review Is Ongoing, Inclusive: Ley

author: Chandra Philip
description: A B.C. teacher has been given a one-day suspension over “inappropriate” stories that contained “content of a sexual nature” that he shared with students. Robert Acheson worked as an inclusion teacher at a high school in the Chilliwack school district when the incidents occurred, according to a consent agreement by the B.C. Commissioner for Teacher […]
title: BC Teacher Suspended for a Day Over ‘Inappropriate’ Comments to Students

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: ACCC says Dendy misled consumers by hiding per-ticket booking fees until late in the online checkout process.
title: Dendy Fined Nearly $20,000 for Misleading Ticket Prices

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Twelve cases of measles in B.C., including three new cases in Chilliwack, have been confirmed. Across Canada, there are now 1,983 confirmed cases of the potentially dangerous infectious airborne disease in the country’s latest outbreak, according to an e-mail from Health Canada to The Epoch Times. “There is indeed a multijurisdictional measles outbreak ongoing in […]
title: More Measles Cases Announced in BC as Nationwide Infections Continue
